009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013/** 
014 * This class defines static methods related to binary
015 * structuring elements (kernels).
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class StructuringElements {
021        
022        private StructuringElements() {}
023
024        /**
025         * Creates and returns a square binary structuring element (kernel)
026         * of size 3x3 (radius 1).
027         * 
028         * @return a 3x3 binary box kernel
029         */
030        public static byte[][] makeBoxKernel3x3() {
031                return makeBoxKernel(1);
032        }
033
034        /**
035         * Creates and returns a square binary "box" kernel
036         * with the specified radius. The kernel size is
037         * (2 * radius + 1) x (2 * radius + 1). It is always odd.
038         * 
039         * @param radius the kernel radius
040         * @return a square binary box kernel
041         */
042        public static byte[][] makeBoxKernel(int radius) {
043                if (radius < 0) {
044                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("radius must be >= 0");
045                }
046                int n = radius + radius + 1;
047                byte[][] H = new byte[n][n];
048                for (int v = 0; v < H.length; v++) {
049                        for (int u = 0; u < H[v].length; u++) {
050                                H[v][u] = 1;
051                        }
052                }
053                return H;
054        }
055
056        // TODO: compare to CircularMask (filters), define BinaryKernel class?
057        /**
058         * Creates and returns a square binary "disk" kernel
059         * with the specified radius. The kernel size is
060         * (2 * radius + 1) x (2 * radius + 1). It is always odd.
061         * 
062         * @param radius the kernel radius
063         * @return a square binary disk kernel
064         */
065        public static byte[][] makeDiskKernel(double radius) {
066                if (radius < 0) {
067                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("radius must be >= 0");
068                }
069                int r = (int) Math.floor(radius);
070                int n = r + r + 1;
071                byte[][] kernel = new byte[n][n];
072                double r2 = sqr(radius) + 0.5;
073                for (int v = -r; v <= r; v++) {
074                        for (int u = -r; u <= r; u++) {
075                                if (sqr(u) + sqr(v) <= r2)
076                                        kernel[v + r][u + r] = 1;
077                        }
078                }
079                return kernel;
080        }
081
082        /**
083         * Converts the specified {@code int[][]}
084         * to a {@code byte[][]}, which is returned.
085         * 
086         * @param iA the {@code int[][]} array to be converted
087         * @return the resulting {@code byte[][]}
088         */
089        public static byte[][] toByteArray(int[][] iA) {
090                byte[][] bA = new byte[iA.length][];
091                for (int i = 0; i < iA.length; i++) {
092                        bA[i] = new byte[iA[i].length];
093                        for (int j = 0; j < iA[i].length; j++) {
094                                bA[i][j] = (byte) iA[i][j];
095                        }
096                }               
097                return bA;
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * Returns a copy of the specified structuring element
102         * that is mirrored along both axes. For example
103         * <pre>
104         * | A B |
105         * | C D |</pre>
106         * converts to
107         * <pre>
108         * | D C |
109         * | B A |</pre>
110         * 
111         * @param H the original structuring element
112         * @return the reflected structuring element
113         */
114        public static byte[][] reflect(byte[][] H) {
115                // mirrors (transposes) the structuring element around the center (hot spot)
116                // used to implement erosion by a dilation
117                final int n = H.length;                 // number of rows
118                final int m = H[0].length;              // number of columns
119                byte[][] rH = new byte[n][m];
120                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
121                        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
122                                rH[j][i] = H[n - j - 1][m - i - 1];
123                        }
124                }
125                return rH;
126        }
127        
128        
129//      @Deprecated
130//      public void showStructuringElement() {
131//              show(H, "Structuring Element");
132//      }
133
134//      public static void show(byte[][] matrix, String title) {
135//              int w = matrix[0].length;
136//              int h = matrix.length;
137//              ImageProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
138//              for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
139//                      for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
140//                              if (matrix[v][u] == 1)
141//                                      ip.putPixel(u, v, 255);
142//                              else
143//                                      ip.putPixel(u, v, 0);
144//                      }
145//              }
146//              ip.invertLut();
147//              ImagePlus im = new ImagePlus(title, ip);
148//              
149//              im.show();
150//      }
151        
152
153}
